title: Men Often Skip Health Screenings
text:
Men Often Skip Health Screenings October 5, 2015, 1:24 PM by Casey Wonnenberg SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
Whether it's to get a colonoscopy or your blood pressure checked, men should see their doctors for regular screenings. 
However, many of the men in our lives skip those appointments. 
"When we're doing a screening test, we're looking for things you don't have symptoms of and are trying to prevent complications down the road," Avera Family Medicine Dr. Joe Seurer said. 
Tonight on HealthBeat on KELOLAND News at 6 p.m. Casey Wonnenberg will look into the recommended screenings for men in their 30s, 40s and 50s.
